result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew D. Hinman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Attempting to Flee/Elude Traffic Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
13 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
Obtain/Maintain full time work/school or a combination.
Not to use/possess controlled substance without valid prescription.
Pur. 973.015, record to be expunged upon successful completion of probation, no new crimes and costs paid in full.

Administrative Transfer to Treatment Court
IT IS ORDERED this case is transferred to Eau Claire County Circuit Court Branch 2 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court program. The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program, or upon defendant's termination from that program.
/s/ December 14, 2015

Court Commissioner Nathan Novak for Judge Schumacher.
